title: Provides for the appointment of a replacement lieutenant-governor by the governor, subject to the approval of the state senate, during permanent vacancy of office
summary: Provides for the appointment of a permanent replacement lieutenant-governor by the governor, subject to the approval of the state senate, during permanent vacancy of the office.

                   CONCURRENT RESOLUTION OF THE SENATE AND ASSEMBLY

       proposing an amendment to sections 5 and 6 of article 4 of the constitu-
         tion, in relation to duties of and the appointment of  lieutenant-gov-
         ernor

    1    Section  1. RESOLVED (if the Senate concur), That section 5 of article
    2  4 of the constitution be amended to read as follows:
    3    S 5. In case of the removal of the governor from office or of  his  or
    4  her  death or resignation, the lieutenant-governor shall become governor
    5  for the remainder of the term.
    6    In case the governor-elect shall decline to serve or  shall  die,  the
    7  lieutenant-governor-elect shall become governor for the full term.
    8    In  case  the  governor is impeached[, is absent from the state] or is
    9  otherwise unable to discharge the powers and duties  of  the  office  of
   10  governor,  the  lieutenant-governor  shall  act  as  governor  until the
   11  inability shall cease or until the term of the governor shall expire.
   12    In case of the failure of the  governor-elect  to  take  the  oath  of
   13  office  at the commencement of his or her term, the lieutenant-governor-
   14  elect shall act as governor until the governor shall take the oath.
   15    S 2. RESOLVED (if the Senate concur), That section 6 of article  4  of
   16  the constitution be amended to read as follows:
   17    S  6. The lieutenant-governor shall possess the same qualifications of
   18  eligibility for office as the governor. The lieutenant-governor shall be
   19  the president of the senate but shall have only a casting vote  therein.
   20  The  lieutenant-governor shall receive for his or her services an annual
   21  salary to be fixed by joint resolution of the senate and assembly.
   22    In case of vacancy in the offices of both governor and lieutenant-gov-
   23  ernor, a governor and  lieutenant-governor  shall  be  elected  for  the
   24  remainder  of  the  term at the next general election happening not less

    1  than three months after  both  offices  shall  have  become  vacant.  No
    2  election  of  a  lieutenant-governor shall be had in any event except at
    3  the time of electing a governor.
    4    In case of vacancy in the offices of both governor and lieutenant-gov-
    5  ernor  or if both of them shall be impeached[, absent from the state] or
    6  otherwise unable to discharge the powers and duties  of  the  office  of
    7  governor,  the  temporary  president of the senate shall act as governor
    8  until the inability shall cease or until a governor shall be elected.
    9    In case of TEMPORARY vacancy  in  the  office  of  lieutenant-governor
   10  alone,  [or  if  the lieutenant-governor shall be impeached, absent] FOR
   11  ABSENCE from the state or otherwise [unable] INABILITY to discharge  the
   12  duties  of  office,  the temporary president of the senate shall perform
   13  all the duties of lieutenant-governor during such vacancy or inability.
   14    IN CASE OF PERMANENT VACANCY  IN  THE  OFFICE  OF  LIEUTENANT-GOVERNOR
   15  ALONE,  ON  GROUNDS  OF  IMPEACHMENT,  RESIGNATION,  DEATH, OR OTHERWISE
   16  PERMANENT ABSENCE FROM THE STATE, THE GOVERNOR SHALL APPOINT A  LIEUTEN-
   17  ANT-GOVERNOR,  SUBJECT  TO  THE  CONFIRMATION  BY A MAJORITY VOTE IN THE
   18  STATE SENATE AND A MAJORITY VOTE IN THE STATE ASSEMBLY, TO  PERFORM  ALL
   19  DUTIES OF SUCH OFFICE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE TERM.
   20    If,  when  the  duty of acting as governor devolves upon the temporary
   21  president of the senate, there be a vacancy in such office or the tempo-
   22  rary president of the senate shall be absent from the state or otherwise
   23  unable to discharge the duties of governor, the speaker of the  assembly
   24  shall act as governor during such vacancy or inability.
   25    The  legislature  may provide for the devolution of the duty of acting
   26  as governor in any case not provided for in this article.
   27    S 3. RESOLVED (if the Senate concur), That the foregoing amendments be
   28  referred to the first regular legislative session  convening  after  the
   29  next  succeeding  general  election  of members of the assembly, and, in
   30  conformity with  section  1  of  article  19  of  the  constitution,  be
   31  published for 3 months previous to the time of such election.
